IP.Name: STM32_WPAN
IP.About: BLE : BlueTooth Low Energy, designed for very low power operation. It supports multiple network topologies, including a point-to-point option used for data transfer, a broadcast option used for location services and a mesh option used for creating large-scale device networks.

RefParameter.Name: BLE_STACK
RefParameter.Description: BLE Wireless Light Stack: GAP Peripheral (Slave) and GATT Server only

RefParameter.Description: Activate RCC only HSE Mode

In the case of TZ=1, must be configured in the non-secure context.

RefParameter.Name: USER_GUIDANCE
RefParameter.DefaultValue: !! Please read carefully Information panel below!!
RefParameter.Description:
In Project Manager, Advanced Settings panel:<>
   • Generate Code shall be unticked for TIM16.<>
   • Do Not Generate Function Call shall be unticked for all IP's associated to STM32WPAN configuration excepted for UART, ADC, TIM16 and CRC.<>
   • Visibility Static shall be unticked for all IP's associated to STM32WPAN configuration excepted for SystemPower_Config an TIM16.<>
   • Register CallBack shall be enabled for UART.<>
In case of TZ=1 project:<>
   • GPIO OSC_OUT pin assignment shall be set to Cortex-M33 no secure<>
   • RTC full secure, located in RTC Security panel shall be disabled<>

RefParameter.Name: USER_GUIDANCE
RefParameter.DefaultValue: !! Please read carefully Information panel below!!
RefParameter.Description:
In Project Manager, Advanced Settings panel:<>
   • Generate Code shall be unticked for CRC and TIM16.<>
   • Do Not Generate Function Call shall be unticked for all IP's associated to STM32WPAN configuration excepted for UART and TIM16.<>
   • Visibility Static shall be unticked for all IP's associated to STM32WPAN configuration excepted for SystemPower_Config, CRC, TIM16 and GPDMA1.<>
   • Register CallBack shall be enabled for UART.<>
In case of TZ=1 project:<>
   • GPIO OSC_OUT pin assignment shall be set to Cortex-M33 no secure<>
   • RTC full secure, located in RTC Security panel shall be disabled<>

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BD_ADDRESS_DEVICE
RefParameter.Description:
List of device address types, used in aci_gap_set_authentication_requirement, possible values:
- Public address(PUBLIC_ADDR 0)
- Static Random address (STATIC_RANDOM_ADDR 1); if you activate RNG then you will get the choice between STATIC and DYNAMIC Random address

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BD_ADDRESS_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of own address types, used for advertise, scan or connect. Possible values:
- Resolvable private address (GAP_RESOLVABLE_PRIVATE_ADDR 2)
- Non resolvable private address(GAP_NON_RESOLVABLE_PRIVATE_ADDR 3)

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BD_ADDRESS_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of own address types, used for advertise, scan or connect. Possible values:
- Public address(GAP_PUBLIC_ADDR 0)

- Non resolvable private address(GAP_NON_RESOLVABLE_PRIVATE_ADDR 3)

RefParameter.Name: CFG_STATIC_RANDOM_ADDRESS

- Dynamic, Random Address is generated with the RNG at each bootup.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_NUM_LINK
RefParameter.Description: Maximum number of simultaneous connections that the device will support

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_NUM_LINK
RefParameter.Description: Maximum number of simultaneous connections that the device will support

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_NUM_GATT_SERVICES
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of Services that can be stored in the GATT database
Maximum value depends on Gatt database size allocated on CPU2
Note that the GAP and GATT services are automatically added so this parameter should be 2 plus the number of user services

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_NUM_GATT_SERVICES
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of Services that can be stored in the GATT database
Maximum value depends on Gatt database size allocated on CPU2
Note that the GAP and GATT services are automatically added so this parameter should be 2 plus the number of user services

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_NUM_GATT_ATTRIBUTES
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of Attributes (i.e. the number of characteristic + the number of characteristic values + the number of descriptors, excluding the services) that can be stored in the GATT database.
Maximum value depends on Gatt database size allocated on CPU2
Note that certain characteristics and relative descriptors are added automatically during device initialization

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_NUM_GATT_ATTRIBUTES
RefParameter.Description:
Maximum number of Attributes (i.e. the number of characteristic + the number of characteristic values + the number of descriptors, excluding the services) that can be stored in the GATT database.
Maximum value depends on Gatt database size allocated on CPU2
Note that certain characteristics and relative descriptors are added automatically during device initialization

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_ATT_MTU_MAX
RefParameter.Description: Maximum supported ATT_MTU size

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_ATT_MTU_MAX
RefParameter.Description: Maximum supported ATT_MTU size

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_ATT_VALUE_ARRAY_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
Size of the storage area for Attribute values
This value depends on the number of attributes used by application. In particular the sum of the following quantities (in octets) should be made for each attribute:
- attribute value length
- 5, if UUID is 16 bit; 19, if UUID is 128 bit
- 2, if server configuration descriptor is used
- 2*DTM_NUM_LINK, if client configuration descriptor is used
- 2, if extended properties is used
The total amount of memory needed is the sum of the above quantities for each attribute.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_ATT_VALUE_ARRAY_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
Size of the storage area for Attribute values
This value depends on the number of attributes used by application. In particular the sum of the following quantities (in octets) should be made for each attribute:
- attribute value length
- 5, if UUID is 16 bit; 19, if UUID is 128 bit
- 2, if server configuration descriptor is used
- 2*DTM_NUM_LINK, if client configuration descriptor is used
- 2, if extended properties is used
The total amount of memory needed is the sum of the above quantities for each attribute.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_ATTR_PREPARE_WRITE_VALUE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
Value defined by the formula DIVC(max_char_size, default_att_mtu - 5) * 2
max_char_size: Maximum characteristics value size
default_att_mtu = 23

RefParameter.Name: CFG_BLE_ATTR_PREPARE_WRITE_VALUE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description:
Value defined by the formula DIVC(max_char_size, default_att_mtu - 5) * 2
max_char_size: Maximum characteristics value size
default_att_mtu = 23

RefParameter.Name: CFG_SCM_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description:
Defines if System Clock Manager is used. This module manages clocks and power configuration in order to reach best power figures.
The system clock configuration will be updated dynamicaly, so for IP we recommend to use stable clock like HSI clock source.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: SCM is not available in BLE Simple mode

RefParameter.Name: CFG_SCM_TIMER
RefParameter.Description: Activate Timer16 in order to allow SCM module to perform timing measurements.

Condition.Expression: (S_BLE_HOST| S_BLE_HOST_SKELETON | S_BLE_SKELETON | S_THREAD | S_THREAD_SKELETON | S_ZIGBEE_SKELETON | S_ZIGBEE | S_mac_802_15_4_SKELETON) & S_CFG_SCM_SUPPORTED_Dis

RefParameter.Name: CFG_SCM_TIMER
RefParameter.Description: Activate Timer16 in order to allow SCM module to perform timing measurements.

Condition.Expression: S_BLE_HOST| S_BLE_HOST_SKELETON | S_BLE_SKELETON | S_THREAD | S_THREAD_SKELETON | S_ZIGBEE_SKELETON | S_ZIGBEE | S_mac_802_15_4_SKELETON

RefParameter.Name: CFG_SCM_TIMER
RefParameter.Description: Activate Timer16 in order to allow SCM module to perform timing measurements.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_LPM_LEVEL
RefParameter.Description:
Low Power Module level selection :
- 0 : Low Power Mode is not activated, RUN mode will be used.
- 1 : Low power active, the one selected with CFG_LPM_STDBY_SUPPORTED
- 2 : In addition log and debug are disabled to reach lowest power figures.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: LPM not available with BLE simplest project OR when HSE is used as Radio Sleep Timer clock

PossibleValue.Comment: LPM enabled and force disable superfluous modules
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: LPM not available with BLE simplest project OR when HSE is used as Radio Sleep Timer clock

RefParameter.Name: CFG_LPM_STDBY_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: Defines if standby or stop2 is used as lowest low power mode, otherwise stop mode is used.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Standby can be enabled only when LPM is enabled
Stop2 can be enabled only on specific targets when LPM is enabled

RefParameter.Name: CFG_LPM_STDBY_WAKEUP_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Defines time to wake up from standby or stop2 before radio event to meet timings.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_LPM_STDBY_WAKEUP_TIME
RefParameter.Description: Defines time to wake up from standby or stop2 before radio event to meet timings.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_RF_TX_POWER_TABLE_ID
RefParameter.Description:
RF TX power table ID selection:
0 -> RF TX output level from -20 dBm to +10 dBm
1 -> RF TX output level from -20 dBm to +3 dBm
2 -> RF TX output level at +20 dBm with an external PA, for Transparent Mode only

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Not available when external PA is enabled
Not available when CFG_TX_POWER is above +3 dBm OR when external PA is enabled

PossibleValue.Comment: at +20 dBm with an external PA
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Available only in Transparent Mode AND when external PA is enabled

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Not available when external PA is enabled

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable LPUART1 (LPUART1 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only)
Please ensure that in ProjectManager Advanced Settings panel MX_LPUART1_UART_Init Not Generate Function call is ticked and that Vibility is unticked

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable LPUART1.
This specific Hardware configuration - configuration is available only if LPUART1 is available and configured by CubeMX user interface.
LPUART1 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED

Condition.Expression: (SEM_REQ_LPUART1TX_GPDMA1CH0 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1TX_GPDMA1CH1 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1TX_GPDMA1CH2 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1TX_GPDMA1CH3 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1TX_GPDMA1CH4 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1TX_GPDMA1CH5 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1TX_GPDMA1CH6 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1TX_GPDMA1CH7) & S_LPUART1

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable LPUART1 DMA TX

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: <font color="red">To enable LPUART1 DMA TX, CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED shall be enabled when available & you need to add relevant DMA request in LPUART1 DMA Settings panel</font>

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_DMA_RX_SUPPORTED

Condition.Expression: (SEM_REQ_LPUART1RX_GPDMA1CH0 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1RX_GPDMA1CH1 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1RX_GPDMA1CH2 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1RX_GPDMA1CH3 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1RX_GPDMA1CH4 | SEM_REQ_GPDMA1RX_LPUART1CH5 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1RX_LPUART1CH6 | SEM_REQ_LPUART1RX_LPUART1CH7) & S_LPUART1

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable LPUART1 DMA RX

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_LPUART1_DMA_RX_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: <font color="red">To enable LPUART1 DMA RX, CFG_HW_LPUART1_ENABLED shall be enabled when available & you need to add relevant DMA request in LPUART1 DMA Settings panel</font>

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable logs USART1 (USART1 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only)
Please ensure that in ProjectManager Advanced Settings panel MX_USART1_UART_Init Not Generate Function call is ticked and that Vibility is unticked

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable logs USART1.
This specific Hardware configuration - configuration is available only if USART1 is configured by CubeMX user interface.
USART1 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED

Condition.Expression: (SEM_REQ_USART1TX_GPDMA1CH0 | SEM_REQ_USART1TX_GPDMA1CH1 | SEM_REQ_USART1TX_GPDMA1CH2 | SEM_REQ_USART1TX_GPDMA1CH3 | SEM_REQ_USART1TX_GPDMA1CH4 | SEM_REQ_USART1TX_GPDMA1CH5 | SEM_REQ_USART1TX_GPDMA1CH6 | SEM_REQ_USART1TX_GPDMA1CH7) & S_USART1

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable USART1 DMA TX

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: <font color="red">To enable USART1 DMA TX, CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED shall be enabled & you need to add relevant DMA request in USART1 DMA Settings panel</font>

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_DMA_RX_SUPPORTED

Condition.Expression: (SEM_REQ_USART1RX_GPDMA1CH0 | SEM_REQ_USART1RX_GPDMA1CH1 | SEM_REQ_USART1RX_GPDMA1CH2 | SEM_REQ_USART1RX_GPDMA1CH3 | SEM_REQ_USART1RX_GPDMA1CH4 | SEM_REQ_USART1RX_GPDMA1CH5 | SEM_REQ_USART1RX_GPDMA1CH6 | SEM_REQ_USART1RX_GPDMA1CH7) & S_USART1

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable USART1 DMA RX

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART1_DMA_RX_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: <font color="red">To enable USART1 DMA RX, CFG_HW_USART1_ENABLED shall be enabled & you need to add relevant DMA request in USART1 DMA Settings panel</font>

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART2_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable logs USART2 (USART2 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only)
Please ensure that in ProjectManager Advanced Settings panel MX_USART2_UART_Init Not Generate Function call is ticked and that Vibility is unticked

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART2_ENABLED
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable logs USART2.
This specific Hardware configuration - configuration is available only if USART2 is configured by CubeMX user interface.
USART2 Mode must be set to Asynchronous with Hardware Flow Control set to CTS only.

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART2_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED

Condition.Expression: (SEM_REQ_USART2TX_GPDMA1CH0 | SEM_REQ_USART2TX_GPDMA1CH1 | SEM_REQ_USART2TX_GPDMA1CH2 | SEM_REQ_USART2TX_GPDMA1CH3 | SEM_REQ_USART2TX_GPDMA1CH4 | SEM_REQ_USART2TX_GPDMA1CH5 | SEM_REQ_USART2TX_GPDMA1CH6 | SEM_REQ_USART2TX_GPDMA1CH7) & S_USART2

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable USART2 DMA TX

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART2_DMA_TX_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: <font color="red">To enable USART2 DMA TX, CFG_HW_USART2_ENABLED shall be enabled & you need to add relevant DMA request in USART2 DMA Settings panel</font>

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART2_DMA_RX_SUPPORTED

Condition.Expression: (SEM_REQ_USART2RX_GPDMA1CH0 | SEM_REQ_USART2RX_GPDMA1CH1 | SEM_REQ_USART2RX_GPDMA1CH2 | SEM_REQ_USART2RX_GPDMA1CH3 | SEM_REQ_USART2RX_GPDMA1CH4 | SEM_REQ_USART2RX_GPDMA1CH5 | SEM_REQ_USART2RX_GPDMA1CH6 | SEM_REQ_USART2RX_GPDMA1CH7) & S_USART2

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable USART2 DMA RX

RefParameter.Name: CFG_HW_USART2_DMA_RX_SUPPORTED
RefParameter.Description: <font color="red">To enable USART2 DMA RX, CFG_HW_USART2_ENABLED shall be enabled & you need to add relevant DMA request in USART2 DMA Settings panel</font>

RefParameter.Name: ADV_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of advertising types, can be:
- Undirected scannable and connectable(ADV_IND 0x00)
- Directed non scannable(ADV_DIRECT_IND 0x01)
- Scannable but non connectable(ADV_SCAN_IND 0x02)
- Non connectable and no scan response (ADV_NONCONN_IND 0x03)
- Scan response(SCAN_RSP 0x03)

PossibleValue.Comment: Non connectable and no scan response (0x03)

RefParameter.Name: ADV_TYPE
RefParameter.Description:
List of application types, can be:
- Transparent mode
- Server profile
- Client profile
- Router profile

RefParameter.Name: ADV_FILTER
RefParameter.Description:
Advertising policy for filtering (white list related), can be:
- Process scan and connection requests from all devices, i.e. the White List is not in use.(NO_WHITE_LIST_USE 0x00)
- Process connection requests from all devices and only scan requests from devices that are in the White List.(WHITE_LIST_FOR_ONLY_SCAN 0x01)
- Process scan requests from all devices and only connection requests from devices that are in the White List (WHITE_LIST_FOR_ONLY_CONN 0x02)
- Process scan and connection requests only from devices in the White List.(WHITE_LIST_FOR_ALL 0x03)

PossibleValue.Comment: Scan & connect only White List devices (0x03)

RefParameter.Name: ADV_FILTER
RefParameter.Description:
List of application types, can be:
- Transparent mode
- Server profile
- Client profile
- Router profile

PossibleValue.Value: 0x04 /* Peripheral and Central Role supported but Peripheral Role preferred for connection establishment */
PossibleValue.Comment: Peripheral and Central Role supported but Peripheral Role preferred for connection establishment (0x04)

PossibleValue.Value: 0x08 /* Peripheral and Central Role supported but Central Role preferred for connection establishment */
PossibleValue.Comment: Peripheral and Central Role supported but Central Role preferred for connection establishment (0x08)

- Client sends start and stop commands to the server.

RefParameter.Name: ZCL_ALARM_ENDPOINT0
RefParameter.Description:
Alarm cluster configure alarm functionality and send alarm notifications.
- Server resides with other clusters which can generate alarm conditions and it sends them to a cluster client. Time server cluster SHALL be set when Alarms server is used.
- Client can send user instructions to the server.

RefParameter.Name: ZCL_ALARM_ENDPOINT0
RefParameter.Description:
Alarm cluster configure alarm functionality and send alarm notifications.
- Server resides with other clusters which can generate alarm conditions and it sends them to a cluster client. Time server cluster SHALL be set when Alarms server is used.

RefParameter.Name: ZCL_TIME_ENDPOINT0

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Server mode is mandoatory if using Alarm in server mode or DRLC in client mode
Server mode is mandoatory if using Alarm in server mode or DRLC in client mode

RefParameter.Description:
Time cluster provides a base for real-time application.
- Server acts as a time master for the network. It SHALL be set when Alarm server or DRLC client are used.
- Client synchronizes itself with the server.

RefParameter.Name: ZCL_TIME_ENDPOINT0
RefParameter.Description:
Time cluster provides a base for real-time application.

Commissioning cluster allows a commissioning process.

RefParameter.Name: ZCL_DIAGNOSTICS_ENDPOINT0
RefParameter.Description:
Diagnostic cluster informs about the operation of the stack over time and will be used by multiple profiles. As a result it should not be set alone.
- Server provides diagnostic data. Attributes are strongly recommended to be stored in persistent memory.
- Client sends requests to access diagnostic data.

RefParameter.Name: ZCL_DIAGNOSTICS_ENDPOINT0
RefParameter.Description:
Diagnostic cluster informs about the operation of the stack over time and will be used by multiple profiles. As a result it should not be set alone.

RefParameter.Name: ZCL_POLL_CONTROL_ENDPOINT0
RefParameter.Description:
Poll Control cluster provides a mechanism for the management of a Zigbee End Device's polling mode.It defines the poll interval between (normal or fast) two MAC Data Requests from the ZED to its parent router.
- Server sets the polling mode to Normal (long poll interval) or Fast (short poll interval) after periodically checking the client.
- Client decides the polling mode to be selected.

RefParameter.Name: ZCL_POLL_CONTROL_ENDPOINT0
RefParameter.Description:
Poll Control cluster provides a mechanism for the management of a Zigbee End Device's polling mode.It defines the poll interval between (normal or fast) two MAC Data Requests from the ZED to its parent router.
- Server sets the polling mode to Normal (long poll interval) or Fast (short poll interval) after periodically checking the client.
- Client decides the polling mode to be selected.
